panel.title: Static Demo Data
panel.html:
Static demo data adds pre-generated incident data to the "alerts" index, both metadata and incident changes.
The timestamp will be changed to "today", so selecting "Last 24 hours" in the Alert Manager dashboards will show demo data.
To load demo data, run these actions below in the correct order by clicking the buttons:
Load Sample Alert Metadata
Load Sample Incidents
Load Sample Incidents Settings
Load Sample Alert Users
Clear Data
** DANGER ** Clear data will remove ALL incidents and their settings!
Clear data only after demo/testing. If you already have real alerts and incidents, use at our own risk! In this case, resolve demo incidents manually.
Disable demo alerts (see panel below)
Clear data
Clear "alerts" index, (refer to Splunk documentation)
Note: Loading demo data only appends new items and won't overwrite any pre-existing alert meta, incident or incident setting data.

html.p:
Demo Alerts are Splunk saved search with the alert handler action enabled (script alert_handler.py) to demonstrate the incident workflow.
Each alert has different settings:

ul.li: demo_alert1_splunk_errors: alert.expires set to 1h, auto_ttl_resolve is set in the Alert Manager Incident Settings --> incidents of this alert will be auto resolved after 1 hour. Auto-assign new incidents to 'demo1'
demo_alert2_splunk_warnings: auto_previous_resolve activated --> only latest incident of this alert has status 'new' and so will be shown on the incident posture dashboard
demo_alert3_rt_splunk_info: Realtime alert; Auto-assign new incidents to 'demo2'

html.p: You can enable/disable these alerts to see the alert manager live in action, in addition to the static demo data.

search.query: | rest splunk_server=local /services/admin/savedsearch | search title="demo_alert*" eai:acl.app="SA-alert_manager_demo" | eval action=if(disabled=1,"disabled","enabled") | table title, eai:acl.app, dispatch.earliest_time, dispatch.latest_time, cron_schedule, alert.severity, alert.expires, action.script.filename, action.script, disabled, action
